content:
• Monday, May 13, 2013
  • NSPH

    Nanosphere (NASDAQ:NSPH) expands into one of the world's largest health-care markets after...

    Nanosphere (NASDAQ:NSPH) expands into one of the world's largest health-care markets after signing a distribution and collaboration agreement with Hitachi High-Tech (OTC:HICTY), giving the company exclusive rights to market NSPH's diagnostic test products in Japan. The two companies also plan to work together on assay and platform development. Terms of the agreement weren't disclosed. Shares +18% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:53 PM
  • TSLA

    For those still keeping score, Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) added another 14.38% to last week's...

    For those still keeping score, Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) added another 14.38% to last week's post-earnings bonanza , bringing the three-day total percentage change to +57%. Amusingly, the rally didn't let up AH either, as the stock tacked on an additional 2.51%, hitting $90 just before 8 p.m.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:42 PM | 22 Comments
  • IDXG

    More on PDI (PDII): Shares are soaring in the post session after posting a Q1 EPS report that...

    More on PDI (PDII): Shares are soaring in the post session after posting a Q1 EPS report that blew away Street estimates. Its bottom-line EPS leapt 800% from the same quarter last year, as total sales grew by 36% over the same period. Operating income swung to a profit on the quarter, largely due to cost cutting efforts and the signing of a $17M multi-year sales contract for which PDII will provide a dedicated team to promote a CNS therapeutic product to neurologists and pain specialists. Shares +30% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:39 PM
  • IDXG

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: PDII +26.9%. NSPH +20.1%. III +11.6%. TTWO +4.1%. NTI...

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: PDII +26.9%. NSPH +20.1%. III +11.6%. TTWO +4.1%. NTI +2.9%.
    After-hours top losers: MOSY -9.4%. ATAX -4.6%. SPH -4.3%. WES -3.9%. OTCPK:IMUC -3.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM
  • WX

    More on Wuxi Pharmatech (NYSE:WX): Q1 beats on all fronts as net earnings rose 3.4% Y/Y on...

    More on Wuxi Pharmatech (NYSE:WX): Q1 beats on all fronts as net earnings rose 3.4% Y/Y on strong growth from its China operations. Laboratory-services revenue increased 13%, including revenue growth of 3.8% at its U.S. laboratory services unit, while revenue from the smaller manufacturing-services segment was up 9.6%. For the current quarter, the company expects to earn between $0.30 - $0.40 per ADS, on revenue of $138M to $140M. Analysts were projecting $0.36 per ADS on $142M, respectively. Shares +2.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM
  • VELTF

    In tandem with its Q1 report, Velti (VELT) announces director and former Johnson &...

    In tandem with its Q1 report, Velti (VELT) announces director and former Johnson & Johnson/Intuit exec Mari Baker is its new COO. Presumably this means former COO Chris Kaskavelis is out. Velti expects Q2 revenue of $42M-$45M, below a $55.2M consensus. No formal 2013 revenue guidance is given, though the company does state revenue "is expected to come in lower than original mid-point guidance of $267.5 million." Velti had $16.3M in cash at the end of Q1, down from $36.6M at the end of Q4; positive 2013 adjusted EBITDA is promised. Over 20% of the workforce has been cut (previous). VELT now -5% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • OPTR

    Shares of Optimer Pharmaceutical (OPTR +14%) ramped up into the close on reports that...

    Shares of Optimer Pharmaceutical (OPTR +14%) ramped up into the close on reports that AstraZeneca (NYSE:AZN), Astellas Pharma (OTCPK:ALPMY) and Cubist Pharmaceuticals (CBST) are among the first round bidders for the antibiotic manufacturer. OPTR disclosed almost three months ago that they were working with Centerview Partners and JPMorgan to explore its strategic options, including a potential sale.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM
  • CPA

    Copa Holdings (NYSE:CPA): Q1 EPS of $2.80 beats by $0.50. Revenue of $641.3M beats by $17.69M....

    Copa Holdings (NYSE:CPA): Q1 EPS of $2.80 beats by $0.50. Revenue of $641.3M beats by $17.69M. Shares +2.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM
  • NTI

    Northern Tier (NYSE:NTI): Q1 EPS of $1.30. Revenue of $1.12B beats by $135.97M. Shares +2.4% AH....

    Northern Tier (NYSE:NTI): Q1 EPS of $1.30. Revenue of $1.12B beats by $135.97M. Shares +2.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM | 2 Comments
  • GHDX

    Genomic Health (NASDAQ:GHDX) files a shelf registration with the SEC to sell, from time to time,...

    Genomic Health (NASDAQ:GHDX) files a shelf registration with the SEC to sell, from time to time, up to 10M shares of its Common Stock. Pricing and other terms have not been disclosed. Shares -1.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:03 PM
  • WX

    WuXi PharmaTech (NYSE:WX): Q1 EPS of $0.35 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $131.9M beats by $1.88M....

    WuXi PharmaTech (NYSE:WX): Q1 EPS of $0.35 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $131.9M beats by $1.88M. Shares +2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:55 PM | 1 Comment
  • VELTF

    Velti (VELT): Q1 EPS of -$0.27 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $41M misses by $1.14M. Shares +4% AH. (PR)

    Velti (VELT): Q1 EPS of -$0.27 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $41M misses by $1.14M. Shares +4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM
  • VZ

    Verizon Wireless is making a fresh $7B cash distribution to owners Verizon (NYSE:VZ) and...

    Verizon Wireless is making a fresh $7B cash distribution to owners Verizon (NYSE:VZ) and Vodafone (NASDAQ:VOD) - Verizon will get $3.85B, and Vodafone $3.15B. A $10B distribution was made in 2011, and an $8.5B distribution last November. CEO Lowell McAdam appeared to be hinting earlier this month Vodafone might not get a distribution this year, as Verizon Wireless focuses on paying down debt. VOD +0.5% AH. VZ +0.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM | 5 Comments
  • III

    Information Services (NASDAQ:III): Q1 EPS of $0.06 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $50.59M beats by...

    Information Services (NASDAQ:III): Q1 EPS of $0.06 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $50.59M beats by $1.52M. Shares +10.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • SPH

    Suburban Propane Partners (NYSE:SPH) -4.5% AH after announcing a public offering of 2.7M common...

    Suburban Propane Partners (NYSE:SPH) -4.5% AH after announcing a public offering of 2.7M common units. SPH says it plan to use the proceeds to repay outstanding unsecured debt up to $135M, and any remainder for working capital and general partnership purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • TSLA

    SolarCity (SCTY): Q1 EPS of -$0.41 misses by $0.15. Revenue of $30M (+21% Y/Y) beats by $900K....

    SolarCity (SCTY): Q1 EPS of -$0.41 misses by $0.15. Revenue of $30M (+21% Y/Y) beats by $900K. 46MW deployed (+12% Y/Y). Nominal contracted payments +10% Q/Q to $1.22B. Expects Q2 revenue of $21M-$28M, below $40.5M consensus. Reiterates guidance for 250MW in 2013 deployments. Now expects positive net cash flow in Q2. Shares -6.2% AH after rising 24.2% in regular trading. CC at 5PM ET (webcast). (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM | 8 Comments
  • WES

    Western Gas Partners (NYSE:WES) -3.5% AH after announcing a public offering of 6.1M common...

    Western Gas Partners (NYSE:WES) -3.5% AH after announcing a public offering of 6.1M common units. WES expects to use the proceeds to pay down debt and for general partnership purposes, including the funding of capital expenditures.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • SFLY

    Shutterfly (NASDAQ:SFLY) -2.2% AH after announcing a $220M offering of convertible senior notes...

    Shutterfly (NASDAQ:SFLY) -2.2% AH after announcing a $220M offering of convertible senior notes due 2018. The company says it plans to use some of the proceeds to fund "acquisitions and other strategic transactions." Shutterfly had $164M in cash and no debt on its balance sheet as of March 30. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • EYPT

    pSivida (PSDV): FQ3 EPS of -$0.12 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $513K misses by $137K. Shares +3.8%...

    pSivida (PSDV): FQ3 EPS of -$0.12 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $513K misses by $137K. Shares +3.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • BIIB

    Biogen-Idec (BIIB +4.5%) finishes the day solidly higher after announcing that the FDA has...

    Biogen-Idec (BIIB +4.5%) finishes the day solidly higher after announcing that the FDA has accepted its Biologics License Application for the marketing approval of Elocate, a treatment for hemophilia A. With the acceptance BIIB now has product candidates under review for both hemophilia A and B.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (ZNGA +7.4%) closes sharply higher in the absence of major news. Enthusiasm about the...

    Zynga (ZNGA +7.4%) closes sharply higher in the absence of major news. Enthusiasm about the performance of new mobile titles Draw Something 2 and Running with Friends could be a factor - AppData's stats (I, II) indicate both games continue to fare well in App Store charts. Zynga's short interest has tripled since November, but is still well below where it stood a year ago.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • TTWO

    Take-Two (NASDAQ:TTWO): FQ4 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.15. Revenue of $303.1M beats by $22.74M....

    Take-Two (NASDAQ:TTWO): FQ4 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.15. Revenue of $303.1M beats by $22.74M. Shares +3.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • AMD

    AMD (AMD +5.8%) is continuing this spring's take-no-prisoners rally/short-squeeze - shares are...

    AMD (AMD +5.8%) is continuing this spring's take-no-prisoners rally/short-squeeze - shares are now up 83% from their April 18 low. This morning, the chipmaker announced a reference design (powered by its Opteron 6300 server CPUs) for Facebook's modular Open Compute server platform. AMD claims servers based on its design can drastically lower ownership costs for a PC virtualization deployment.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 4 Comments
  • GWR

    Genesee & Wyoming (GWR -0.7%) says consolidated traffic rose 7.3% in April Y/Y, aided by...

    Genesee & Wyoming (GWR -0.7%) says consolidated traffic rose 7.3% in April Y/Y, aided by higher shipments of petroleum products, metallic ores and lumber. Consolidated traffic rose to 157,695 carloads from 146,947 over the same period, while same-railroad carloads rose 5.6%. Metallic ores and petroleum product carloads rose 30% and 70%, respectively, while lumber and forest products carloads were up 18%. But coal and coke carloads, its largest segment, fell 3.4%, with an even sharper decline was in agricultural products, which were down 8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM
  • ANRZQ

    Alpha Natural Resources (ANR -2.5%) slips today after Standard & Poor's lowered its outlook...

    Alpha Natural Resources (ANR -2.5%) slips today after Standard & Poor's lowered its outlook on the coal producer to Negative from Stable late Friday. The ratings agency noted that continued weakness in coal is likely challenge the company's operating conditions, especially within the Central Appalachian thermal and metallurgical coal markets.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM | 1 Comment
  • MOS

    Investors are disappointed by Mosaic's (MOS -3.1%) guidance for its cash surplus, but the delay...

    Investors are disappointed by Mosaic's (MOS -3.1%) guidance for its cash surplus, but the delay in potash production may be a good move for the company and the broader fertilizer industry, Citi's P.J. Juvekar says. He has expected higher potash supply, which could weigh on prices, over the next five years because of projects from competitors.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM
  • WCRX

    Buckingham joins in on the Warner Chilcott (WCRX +6%)/Activis (ACT -0.3%) lovefest, upping its...

    Buckingham joins in on the Warner Chilcott (WCRX +6%)/Activis (ACT -0.3%) lovefest, upping its price target on Warner to $24, adding that it sees the potential for a debt-financing deal as high as $30 per share for the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM
  • ZOLT

    Zoltek (ZOLT -3%) slips after its FQ2 revenue came in below Street expectations. The company...

    Zoltek (ZOLT -3%) slips after its FQ2 revenue came in below Street expectations. The company reported net sales of $33M, versus consensus estimates for $37.5M. Sales declined by 29% Y/Y, due almost exclusively to reduced activity in the wind energy market, which has negatively affected all industry participants - from the suppliers of glass and carbon fibers and other materials to the manufacturers of wind turbines.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • UNXL

    UniPixel (UNXL -1.8%) is down, but off its morning lows, after Barron's argues investors should...

    UniPixel (UNXL -1.8%) is down, but off its morning lows, after Barron's argues investors should take a cautious approach to the high-flyer. While noting the potential of UniPixel's UniBoss touchscreen film to replace traditional ITO touchscreen tech, the paper also notes the presence of rival film solutions from Atmel (NASDAQ:ATML) and Fuji, and discusses the failure of UniPixel's TMOS display panel and fingerprint-resistant film technologies to catch on.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM | 2 Comments
  • GLUU

    A bullish weekend column from SA contributor R.J. Chopin seems to be giving a lift to Glu Mobile...

    A bullish weekend column from SA contributor R.J. Chopin seems to be giving a lift to Glu Mobile (GLUU +6.2%). Chopin is upbeat about the impact of further smartphone adoption in the U.S. and elsewhere, as well as the enormous popularity of mobile gaming among smartphone owners. He's also a fan of Glu's online gambling efforts, and its decision to focus on fewer, higher-quality titles backed by constant updates. Glu filed its Q1 10-Q on Friday.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • GNVC

    GenVec (GNVC -33%) gets slammed today after its FQ4 missed hard on the revenue side. Sales were...

    GenVec (GNVC -33%) gets slammed today after its FQ4 missed hard on the revenue side. Sales were down 56% year over year, impacted by a decline in revenue from its hearing loss and balance disorders, HIV, and foot and mouth disease programs.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM
  • NFLX

    "I think Netflix (NFLX +4.1%) could be this decade's Amazon," says Whitney Tilson in a Yahoo...

    "I think Netflix (NFLX +4.1%) could be this decade's Amazon," says Whitney Tilson in a Yahoo talk (video). Though Tilson admits to "trimming" his position during Netflix's run-up, he still considers it undervalued relative to other media providers - "They're trading at $400 per subscriber in a world of $1,000 per sub" - and argues its scale gives it a big edge - "Who else is going to spend $3 billion a year for streaming content?" Of course, many of the firms valued at $1,000/sub are getting a lot more than $8/month. Netflix investors seem to be betting the company's library and customer loyalty will allow it to raise prices over time. (U.K. deals)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM | 7 Comments
  • MSFT

    "This deal was nothing more than a rumor . [Microsoft] has no intention of acquiring the NOOK...

    "This deal was nothing more than a rumor ... [Microsoft] has no intention of acquiring the NOOK unit. NOOK is closely integrated with Android ... The acquisition is not happening in the foreseeable future as Microsoft Corporation is assessing its options at this time." Thus speaks a Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) source to Insider Monkey, strongly refuting a TechCrunch report about an offer to buy Nook Media's digital assets for $1B. Barnes & Noble (BKS -14.1%) shares have plunged, but for now are still up 13% from where they stood prior to the report.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM | 3 Comments
  • I

    Recent IPO Intelsat (I +6.1%) moves higher today after announcing earlier that it's commenced a...

    Recent IPO Intelsat (I +6.1%) moves higher today after announcing earlier that it's commenced a solicitation of consents from holders of its 8.5% Senior Notes due 2019. Also, its subsidiary will issue a notice of redemption for its 11.25% Senior Notes due 2017. It intends to redeem the notes on June 12.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble (BKS -9.9%) spikes lower after Insider Monkey reports that a source inside...

    Barnes & Noble (BKS -9.9%) spikes lower after Insider Monkey reports that a source inside Microsoft indicates nothing is imminent from the company on a plan to buy Nook Media.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM | 1 Comment
  • CEL

    Israeli carrier Cellcom (CEL -5%) dives after missing Q1 estimates, and takes rival Partner...

    Israeli carrier Cellcom (CEL -5%) dives after missing Q1 estimates, and takes rival Partner (PTNR -4.3%) down with it. An intense price war sparked by the arrival of 6 new carriers led Q1 revenue to fall 20.6% Y/Y, and the company's subscriber base to fall 5.7% Y/Y to 3.17M. The slump has led Cellcom to suspend its dividend. It expects revenue to fall again in Q2, albeit at a "more moderate rate than experienced in previous quarters." Meanwhile, financing costs are expected to rise, thanks to high inflation. SG&A spend fell 18% Y/Y in Q1, as Cellcom continues reaping synergies from its 2011 merger with NetVision. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM
  • AZO

    In a valuation call, Deutsche Bank downgrades AutoZone (AZO -1.6%) to Hold from Buy. After...

    In a valuation call, Deutsche Bank downgrades AutoZone (AZO -1.6%) to Hold from Buy. After rising more than 15% YTD, the shares are getting ahead of analyst Mike Baker's $410 price target, not to mention outpacing both the broad market and the S&P retail index. DB's target is based on 13x FY14 EPS estimates, which the bank says is a reasonable assumption based on historical precedent (AZO typically trades at 12.5-13x).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM
  • DRIV-OLD

    Digital River (DRIV-OLD +12%) surges on news four different insiders - CEO David Dobson (30K...

    Digital River (DRIV-OLD +12%) surges on news four different insiders - CEO David Dobson (30K shares), CFO Stefan Schulz (1K), General Counsel Kevin Crudden (9K), and director Thomas Madison (9K) bought shares last week; the average purchase price was $14.90. Shares of the e-commerce/online download software firm have traded in a fairly narrow range since last summer. (FQ4 beat)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM
  • PCYC

    Pharmacyclics (PCYC +9.5%) trades higher today after RBC Capital ups the shares to Outperform...

    Pharmacyclics (PCYC +9.5%) trades higher today after RBC Capital ups the shares to Outperform and raises its price target to $100 from $70. The firm cites optimism over a number of upcoming catalysts for its leukemia drug Ibrutnib, which is being jointly developed by PCYC and JNJ's Janssen Pharmaceuticals.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • DDD

    A bullish Canaccord report is helping 3D Systems (DDD +7.5%) shoot higher. In spite of the...

    A bullish Canaccord report is helping 3D Systems (DDD +7.5%) shoot higher. In spite of the dilution caused by its stock offering, the firm thinks 3D can beat estimates thanks to strong printer and services revenue, and believes multiple expansion is in the cards as the company commercializes Bespoke Innovations' 3D-printed carpal tunnel braces in 2H. Canaccord's PT has been lifted to $50 from $45. Meanwhile, Stratasys (SSYS +2.1%) is now trekking higher following its Q1 report. On its earnings call, the company mentioned it's still "looking to grow through strategic acquisitions," and that it believes it can maintain its Q1 gross margin for the rest of the year.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM
  • ALIM

    Shares of Alimera Sciences (ALIM +20%) ramp up today despite posting a wider than expected loss...

    Shares of Alimera Sciences (ALIM +20%) ramp up today despite posting a wider than expected loss in its Q1 report on Friday, largely due to the company's announcement that Iluvien had become commercially available in the UK and Germany. The PDUFA goal date for the drug with the FDA is October 17th of this year.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • PNTR

    Midday top 10 gainers: PNTR +65%. TGX +36%. SCTY +33%. CNIT-OLD +28%. SUTR +20%. UNIS +19%. ALIM...

    Midday top 10 gainers: PNTR +65%. TGX +36%. SCTY +33%. CNIT-OLD +28%. SUTR +20%. UNIS +19%. ALIM +19%. LEDS +19%. NOAH +17%. HTCH +17%.
    Midday top 10 losers: GNVC -34%. OTC:ATEA -18%. SBLK -18%. RCON -15%. EOX -8%. DRWI -8%. PLG -8%. MRIN -8%. JOSB -7%. CIMT -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM
  • AGNC

    The mortgage REITs are lit up bright red (MORT -1.9%), again led by American Capital Agency...

    The mortgage REITs are lit up bright red (MORT -1.9%), again led by American Capital Agency (AGNC -3.5%) and American Capital Mortgage (MTGE -3%), with Annaly (NLY -3.1%) not far behind. Yes, the 10-year Treasury yield is a 3 bps higher, but there's also rare action in Fed Funds futures, now pricing in a whopping 50 bps in rate hikes by this time 2016. AGNC presents at the JMP Conference at 2 ET.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM | 39 Comments
  • EDG

    Edgen Group (EDG -3.2%) sets new 52-week lows today on a big Q1 earnings miss. Net sales...

    Edgen Group (EDG -3.2%) sets new 52-week lows today on a big Q1 earnings miss. Net sales declined 24% Y/Y, as the steel-products manufacturer's energy-and-infrastructure business was hit hard by steel-pricing and delays in contract awards and customer-purchasing decisions. Sales in its oil-tubular goods segment also decreased 10% over the same period due largely to lower rig counts. In light of the weak environment, the company is suspending its 2013 guidance - which doesn't bode well for a company just went public a year ago.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM | 1 Comment
  • EVEP-OLD

    EV Energy Partners (EVEP-OLD -5.4%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy with a $54 price target (from...

    EV Energy Partners (EVEP-OLD -5.4%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy with a $54 price target (from $78) at Wunderlich based on uncertainty around its Utica properties. The firm has said Utica could add value to EVEP if the partnership could monetize the properties, but saw downside risk if significant return was not realized; given current uncertainty, it is more prudent to lower the value for the properties.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM
  • ENDP

    Endo Health Solutions (ENDP -2.6%) appears to have stabilized today, albeit lower, following a...

    Endo Health Solutions (ENDP -2.6%) appears to have stabilized today, albeit lower, following a couple of trading halts on volatility just prior to Friday's close after the FDA denied its petition to halt generic competition to its painkiller Opana ER on safety grounds. The ruling will mean a big hit to earnings next quarter, and likely lead exploring options to mitigate the damage. Jefferies says the FDA was wrong, and acted "irrationally inconsistent" in its decision. Nonetheless, the firm lowers its price target on the shares from $47.00 to $37.00.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM
  • FRO

    Oil tanker trade is growing at its fastest pace in 10 years as the U.S. production boom is...

    Oil tanker trade is growing at its fastest pace in 10 years as the U.S. production boom is forcing exporters, who used to ship oil to U.S. markets, to find new customers on different trade routes, FT reports. A 10% jump in the number of oil-ton miles comes even as the volume of oil traded has flatlined,good news for tanker companies such as Frontline (FRO +8.6%) and Overseas Shipholding (OSGIQ.PK +3.3%).

     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • RCON

    Recon Technology (RCON -13.6%) falls hard after reporting results for FQ3. Highlights: revenue...

    Recon Technology (RCON -13.6%) falls hard after reporting results for FQ3. Highlights: revenue falls 42.4% Y/Y to $1.2M; gross margins increase 850 basis points on a higher percentage of software sales in the product mix; net loss attributable to shareholders is $0.05 per share versus a slight profit in FQ3 2012. Management calls the revenue decline "temporary," citing "timing issues related to project completion status," and assures investors it is not related to "any changes in business fundamentals." Based on today's trading, shareholders may be skeptical. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM
  • SQNM

    Credit Suisse upgrades Sequenom (SQNM +7.5%) to Neutral and raises its price target to $4.50...

    Credit Suisse upgrades Sequenom (SQNM +7.5%) to Neutral and raises its price target to $4.50 from $4, citing decreased risk stemming from the company's five-year agreement with Blue Cross and Blue Shield (see CC) for the MaterniT21 PLUS test. Analyst Vamil Divan notes that "following daily moves in [the stock] can get one dizzy" — today is no exception — but CS sees SQNM running 175K tests in FY13 versus company projections of 150K and says that ultimately, robust volumes are enough to support the story at least for the foreseeable future. (See also: Q1 earnings)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • EOX

    The net result of several pieces of news from Emerald Oil (EOX -8.8%) sends shares sharply...

    The net result of several pieces of news from Emerald Oil (EOX -8.8%) sends shares sharply lower. EOX says it will commence a public offering of 10M shares of common stock, receives a commitment from White Deer to acquire common stock, raises its capital budget and guidance and raises its net operated well estimate for 2013 to 12 from previous guidance of 8.2.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • TGX

    Theragenics (TGX +34.2%) soars near a two-year high this morning after Juniper Investment ups...

    Theragenics (TGX +34.2%) soars near a two-year high this morning after Juniper Investment ups its buyout offer for the small medical-device maker to between $2.25 and $2.30 per share from its previous offer of $2.05 to $2.10.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • MOS

    Mosaic (MOS -2.8%) says it is deferring a project to add 2M metric tons/year of potash...

    Mosaic (MOS -2.8%) says it is deferring a project to add 2M metric tons/year of potash production capacity due to unfavorable market conditions. Also, MOS expects its recurring dividend per share to grow in-line with earnings, and says it favors repurchases over dividends to deploy surplus cash. It expects to meet updated liquidity and leverage targets within the next 12-24 months. (slide show)
